answers.answer: Hi!Yes, any procedure during that time may affect your chances of conceiving. At this stage, it would be best to avoid pregnancy until you have biopsy results. You can then plan a pregnancy after all this has been sorted out.Also, since you have been trying for two years maybe you can undergo other tests to find out what could be wrong—whether you are ovulating, have hormone imbalance, PCOD, thyroid problems, diabetes etc. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: Am am 35 yrs old i have a 12yrs old and have trying to conceive for two yrs.. I just got a pill from my doctor to help me conceive and when i was on the last pill got a call from the doctor and found out i have hpv.. I have a appointment in a few days and they might do a biopy,, I am going to be ovulating when i go in for this,, will this affect me conceiving???
title: Hpv
